sentence.Network_en: We may determine the height of a mountain by trigonometry.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们可用三角原理测定山的高度.

sentence.Network_en: He received a low mark for trigonometry.
The climax of this work was the development of trigonometry.
sentence.Network_cn: 三角术的发展是这项工作的高峰.

...她的领居是一位附近学校的科学教授,一年后的一天他把一本自己写的书给了桑雅家,当桑雅读这本书的时候,她遇到了三角法,trigonometry,一个她从没有听过的名次,为了搞懂书中的一些推论,她使用了,什么的正弦,和其他一些她能想到的方法,这.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from modern Latin trigonometria (see trigon, -metry)

entry.def: Trigonometry is the branch of mathematics that is concerned with calculating the angles of triangles or the lengths of their sides.

means.word_mean: 1. the mathematics of triangles and trigonometric functions
